field_edited_text.value:
Conversion or elimination of incompatible use
or buildings

Use of rehabilitation where possible, in
preference to demolishing buildings

Incentives to owners to carry out rehabilitation

Increased services and facilities in improvement
areas

Uses of vacant land for retail and other uses
consistent with core area plans

8. General Considerations

In developing the goals and planning objectives
for the three areas, it became apparent that the
core areas served as focal points in their
communities as well as local centers for
shopping and other services.



They act as employment centers as well as areas
where people meet and mingle in a variety of
social activities. They form part of a general
group of facilities and services which people in
cities need and depend upon.

As a result of these considerations, a further
broad objective was developed which was not
provided for in the more functional objectives
listed. This was the development of these core
areas to the fullest degree as focal points of
neighborhood activity. This objective was
emphasized in preparing design plans for the
three areas and in recommending activities
which could be incorporated into them.

el
